py_sim.00_homework.03_Vehicle_models module¶

03_Vehicle_models.py contains functions required for running homework #3

py_sim.00_homework.03_Vehicle_models.carrot_follow_unicycle() → None¶

Runs an example of a go-to-goal vector field combined with obstacle avoidance to show off the sensor measurements being performed. The optional ability to follow a path allows the vehicle to navigate around complex obstacles.

Parameters:

follow_path – True => a path will be created and followed, False => the vector field will alone be used for navigating to the goal

py_sim.00_homework.03_Vehicle_models.run_bicycle_arc_example() → None¶

Runs an example of a vehicle executing an arc

Parameters:

model – The model used for the simple dynamics

py_sim.00_homework.03_Vehicle_models.run_differential_drive_arc_example() → None¶

Runs an example of a vehicle executing an arc

Parameters:

model – The model used for the simple dynamics

py_sim.00_homework.03_Vehicle_models.run_unicycle_arc_example() → None¶

Runs an example of a vehicle executing an arc

Parameters:

model – The model used for the simple dynamics

py_sim.00_homework.03_Vehicle_models.simple_field_unicycle() → None¶

Runs an example of a go-to-goal vector field combined with an obstacle avoidance field.
